body:
I don't know what's going on in the past year or so, perhaps a reaction to the riots this summer and all the shit going on in recent months. But look at Joe Biden 40 years ago and all the "old Democrats" who were leftists with right-wing cultural beliefs and most of you sound exactly like them now.

What's happened is you abandoned freedom. What happened to small government, individual liberty, free markets, free speech, and the constitution? It seems you've become obsessed and fixated with nothing but beating the other side lately, and have been resorting to authoritarian means to do so. Are you even conservatives anymore? I wouldn't say so, because this new philosophy doesn't at all align with founding values.

Lately I've seen a lot of comments saying certain people should be banned from being able to hold office, serve in the military, or even be censored ([this thread ](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative/post/6ube/joe-biden-taps-transgender-official-as) alone has many examples). I've even seen a few complaining about how there's too much diversity and that's our problem (it used to be *forced* diversity that was complained about, because it's annoying PC crap). Even the sidebar of this guild says "no egalitarianism", which used to be one of the constitutional pillars for conservatives, "all men are created equal" (to clarify: in the sense of equality, not equity). Support for limited government, individual rights, equality under the law, and free markets is waning. None of this was happening until about a year ago. Up until then, conservatives could be defined as rooted in the moderately libertarian founding values of the USA, with some republic thrown in as necessary. That's definitely not true anymore. Many conservatives had strong beliefs but it was vital that they not be forced on others like the Democrats do, especially by the government. But now many of you want just that. If I had seen conservatives just 5 years ago I wouldn't even recognize you now. What the fuck happened? Are you trying to actually become what the media has been slandering you as for all these years?

Edit: See, this is another example of their censorship, the [+"Conservative"](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative) guild kicked this post because it doesn't support their new alt ideology, even though it's in line with actual conservatism.

original_guild.description:
Conservative news, commentary, memes, and organizing information.

The term "conservative" comes from the Latin verb for "to conserve or preserve," and reflects the nature of conservatives as those who seek to preserve the best of human endeavor and nature throughout all of history, measuring it qualitatively to achieve excellence (*arete*) in defiance of the human tendency toward solipsism (*hubris*).

We include all conservatives from Republicans, paleoconservatives, monarchists, anarcho-monarchists, traditionalists, Nietzscheans, crunchy conservatives, Alt-Right, Ult Right, neoreactionaries, and social conservatives onward. No socialism or egalitarianism please.

* [Moderation guidelines](http://www.amerika.org/politics/ruqqus-conservative-moderation/)
* [FAQ](http://www.amerika.org/politics/ask-a-conservative/)

We include all conservatives from Republicans, paleoconservatives, monarchists, anarcho-monarchists, traditionalists, Nietzscheans, crunchy conservatives, Alt-Right, Ult Right, neoreactionaries, and social conservatives onward. No socialism or egalitarianism please.

post.title: I'm sorry, but most of you have become right-wing Democrats

body:
We changed because we woke up. None of the things you listed can happen in a multi-cultural  and multi-ethnic society. Different peoples have different inherit values. The founding stock of the US (from North and West Europe) had a strong culture of individuality and self-reliance. Many of us have come to the realization that culture doesn't spring from the dirt but from the peoples that harbor it. Living on a patch of ground doesn't make your values change. If your people are the kind that desire a strong government and leaders then that's what you'll vote for in a democracy. If your people wish to elevate themselves above others then that's what you'll vote for. This has been shown time and again through election results. The unwritten rules of society govern as much as the written ones, take freedom of speech for example if the government can't censor your speech but private business can then the only thing keeping those businesses from censoring you is the inherit culture that values that freedom. When that freedom takes a back seat to other ethnic concerns, like erasing Whiteness, then you have moved outside the culture. 

There is a reason successful democracies have only occurred in European and European diaspora nations.

body:
Yet you're using that same strong government and censorship system to try and achieve small government and free speech? That doesn't make any sense.

Since when did conservatives start believing in identity politics, "if you don't vote democrat then you ain't black (or any other "minority" group)"? That used to be a leftist thing.

> When that freedom takes a back seat to other ethnic concerns, like erasing Whiteness, then you have moved outside the culture.

That's a problem, but now it seems conservatives are doing the exact same thing, only for the opposite cause. Freedom has taken a backseat for conservatives too now, because the biggest concern is taking care of things.

body:
>Yet you're using that same strong government and censorship system to try and achieve small government and free speech?

No. We're trying to not get wiped out. 

>Since when did conservatives start believing in identity politics...

Since we decided that being attacked for being White was wrong. The left will bludgeon the right to death with Idpol but the right should just take it? 

>Freedom has taken a backseat for conservatives too now, because the biggest concern is taking care of things.

You apparently missed the part I wrote about freedom being impossible in a multi-cultural and multi-ethnic society. The left has created a coalition of anti-White racialists whose goal it is to make White people second class citizens in the lands their ancestors conquered. They have preyed upon our idealism to force themselves into positions of power to accomplish this goal. So now we set aside our ideals to deal with the reality.

post.body:
I don't know what's going on in the past year or so, perhaps a reaction to the riots this summer and all the shit going on in recent months. But look at Joe Biden 40 years ago and all the "old Democrats" who were leftists with right-wing cultural beliefs and most of you sound exactly like them now.

What's happened is you abandoned freedom. What happened to small government, individual liberty, free markets, free speech, and the constitution? It seems you've become obsessed and fixated with nothing but beating the other side lately, and have been resorting to authoritarian means to do so. Are you even conservatives anymore? I wouldn't say so, because this new philosophy doesn't at all align with founding values.

Lately I've seen a lot of comments saying certain people should be banned from being able to hold office, serve in the military, or even be censored ([this thread ](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative/post/6ube/joe-biden-taps-transgender-official-as) alone has many examples). I've even seen a few complaining about how there's too much diversity and that's our problem (it used to be *forced* diversity that was complained about, because it's annoying PC crap). Even the sidebar of this guild says "no egalitarianism", which used to be one of the constitutional pillars for conservatives, "all men are created equal" (to clarify: in the sense of equality, not equity). Support for limited government, individual rights, equality under the law, and free markets is waning. None of this was happening until about a year ago. Up until then, conservatives could be defined as rooted in the moderately libertarian founding values of the USA, with some republic thrown in as necessary. That's definitely not true anymore. Many conservatives had strong beliefs but it was vital that they not be forced on others like the Democrats do, especially by the government. But now many of you want just that. If I had seen conservatives just 5 years ago I wouldn't even recognize you now. What the fuck happened? Are you trying to actually become what the media has been slandering you as for all these years?

Edit: See, this is another example of their censorship, the [+"Conservative"](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative) guild kicked this post because it doesn't support their new alt ideology, even though it's in line with actual conservatism.

body:
> Since we decided that being attacked for being White was wrong.

That's *anti* identity politics. That means racism against white people is wrong. It doesn't mean all non-whites are batshit crazy lefties just because the media hates on whites, but you seem to think that now. You used to complain about how the left reacted to racism with reverse racism, which made perfect sense, but now you're reacting yourself with reverse reverse racism?

> You apparently missed the part I wrote about freedom being impossible in a multi-cultural and multi-ethnic society. The left has created a coalition of anti-White racialists whose goal it is to make White people second class citizens in the lands their ancestors conquered. They have preyed upon our idealism to force themselves into positions of power to accomplish this goal.

You seem like you need to be reminded that 99.99999% of those radical white-bashing leftists are white SJWs or CEOs.

> So now we set aside our ideals to deal with the reality.

I'm sorry, but that's just wrong and hypocritical. That gives me the impression that you don't actually care about your ideals unless it's about you.
body_html:
Since we decided that being attacked for being White was wrong.

That's anti identity politics. That means racism against white people is wrong. It doesn't mean all non-whites are batshit crazy lefties just because the media hates on whites, but you seem to think that now. You used to complain about how the left reacted to racism with reverse racism, which made perfect sense, but now you're reacting yourself with reverse reverse racism?

You apparently missed the part I wrote about freedom being impossible in a multi-cultural and multi-ethnic society. The left has created a coalition of anti-White racialists whose goal it is to make White people second class citizens in the lands their ancestors conquered. They have preyed upon our idealism to force themselves into positions of power to accomplish this goal.

You seem like you need to be reminded that 99.99999% of those radical white-bashing leftists are white SJWs or CEOs.

So now we set aside our ideals to deal with the reality.

I'm sorry, but that's just wrong and hypocritical. That gives me the impression that you don't actually care about your ideals unless it's about you.

post.body:
I don't know what's going on in the past year or so, perhaps a reaction to the riots this summer and all the shit going on in recent months. But look at Joe Biden 40 years ago and all the "old Democrats" who were leftists with right-wing cultural beliefs and most of you sound exactly like them now.

What's happened is you abandoned freedom. What happened to small government, individual liberty, free markets, free speech, and the constitution? It seems you've become obsessed and fixated with nothing but beating the other side lately, and have been resorting to authoritarian means to do so. Are you even conservatives anymore? I wouldn't say so, because this new philosophy doesn't at all align with founding values.

Lately I've seen a lot of comments saying certain people should be banned from being able to hold office, serve in the military, or even be censored ([this thread ](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative/post/6ube/joe-biden-taps-transgender-official-as) alone has many examples). I've even seen a few complaining about how there's too much diversity and that's our problem (it used to be *forced* diversity that was complained about, because it's annoying PC crap). Even the sidebar of this guild says "no egalitarianism", which used to be one of the constitutional pillars for conservatives, "all men are created equal" (to clarify: in the sense of equality, not equity). Support for limited government, individual rights, equality under the law, and free markets is waning. None of this was happening until about a year ago. Up until then, conservatives could be defined as rooted in the moderately libertarian founding values of the USA, with some republic thrown in as necessary. That's definitely not true anymore. Many conservatives had strong beliefs but it was vital that they not be forced on others like the Democrats do, especially by the government. But now many of you want just that. If I had seen conservatives just 5 years ago I wouldn't even recognize you now. What the fuck happened? Are you trying to actually become what the media has been slandering you as for all these years?

Edit: See, this is another example of their censorship, the [+"Conservative"](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative) guild kicked this post because it doesn't support their new alt ideology, even though it's in line with actual conservatism.

parent.body:
> Since we decided that being attacked for being White was wrong.

That's *anti* identity politics. That means racism against white people is wrong. It doesn't mean all non-whites are batshit crazy lefties just because the media hates on whites, but you seem to think that now. You used to complain about how the left reacted to racism with reverse racism, which made perfect sense, but now you're reacting yourself with reverse reverse racism?

> You apparently missed the part I wrote about freedom being impossible in a multi-cultural and multi-ethnic society. The left has created a coalition of anti-White racialists whose goal it is to make White people second class citizens in the lands their ancestors conquered. They have preyed upon our idealism to force themselves into positions of power to accomplish this goal.

You seem like you need to be reminded that 99.99999% of those radical white-bashing leftists are white SJWs or CEOs.

> So now we set aside our ideals to deal with the reality.

I'm sorry, but that's just wrong and hypocritical. That gives me the impression that you don't actually care about your ideals unless it's about you.

I wouldn't say so, because this new philosophy doesn't at all align with founding values.

Lately I've seen a lot of comments saying certain people should be banned from being able to hold office, serve in the military, or even be censored ([this thread ](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative/post/6ube/joe-biden-taps-transgender-official-as) alone has many examples). I've even seen a few complaining about how there's too much diversity and that's our problem (it used to be *forced* diversity that was complained about, because it's annoying PC crap). Even the sidebar of this guild says "no egalitarianism", which used to be one of the constitutional pillars for conservatives, "all men are created equal" (to clarify: in the sense of equality, not equity). Support for limited government, individual rights, equality under the law, and free markets is waning. None of this was happening until about a year ago. Up until then, conservatives could be defined as rooted in the moderately libertarian founding values of the USA, with some republic thrown in as necessary. That's definitely not true anymore. Many conservatives had strong beliefs but it was vital that they not be forced on others like the Democrats do, especially by the government. But now many of you want just that. If I had seen conservatives just 5 years ago I wouldn't even recognize you now. What the fuck happened? Are you trying to actually become what the media has been slandering you as for all these years?

Edit: See, this is another example of their censorship, the [+"Conservative"](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative) guild kicked this post because it doesn't support their new alt ideology, even though it's in line with actual conservatism.

Any conservative worth their salt fell straight to independent voters from the word go. 

I may vote on republicans because between choice A and B it is much closer to conservatism. 

But no good conservative was on the Republicans side to begin with, and rather was choosing the lesser of the two evils all along.

Up until then, conservatives could be defined as rooted in the moderately libertarian founding values of the USA, with some republic thrown in as necessary. That's definitely not true anymore. Many conservatives had strong beliefs but it was vital that they not be forced on others like the Democrats do, especially by the government. But now many of you want just that. If I had seen conservatives just 5 years ago I wouldn't even recognize you now. What the fuck happened? Are you trying to actually become what the media has been slandering you as for all these years?

post.body:
I don't know what's going on in the past year or so, perhaps a reaction to the riots this summer and all the shit going on in recent months. But look at Joe Biden 40 years ago and all the "old Democrats" who were leftists with right-wing cultural beliefs and most of you sound exactly like them now.

What's happened is you abandoned freedom. What happened to small government, individual liberty, free markets, free speech, and the constitution? It seems you've become obsessed and fixated with nothing but beating the other side lately, and have been resorting to authoritarian means to do so. Are you even conservatives anymore? I wouldn't say so, because this new philosophy doesn't at all align with founding values.

Lately I've seen a lot of comments saying certain people should be banned from being able to hold office, serve in the military, or even be censored ([this thread ](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative/post/6ube/joe-biden-taps-transgender-official-as) alone has many examples). I've even seen a few complaining about how there's too much diversity and that's our problem (it used to be *forced* diversity that was complained about, because it's annoying PC crap). Even the sidebar of this guild says "no egalitarianism", which used to be one of the constitutional pillars for conservatives, "all men are created equal" (to clarify: in the sense of equality, not equity). Support for limited government, individual rights, equality under the law, and free markets is waning. None of this was happening until about a year ago. Up until then, conservatives could be defined as rooted in the moderately libertarian founding values of the USA, with some republic thrown in as necessary. That's definitely not true anymore. Many conservatives had strong beliefs but it was vital that they not be forced on others like the Democrats do, especially by the government. But now many of you want just that. If I had seen conservatives just 5 years ago I wouldn't even recognize you now. What the fuck happened? Are you trying to actually become what the media has been slandering you as for all these years?

Edit: See, this is another example of their censorship, the [+"Conservative"](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative) guild kicked this post because it doesn't support their new alt ideology, even though it's in line with actual conservatism.

body:
Okay after looking at that I'm almost positive it's some kind of false flag site. Right off the bat, I get 2 main takeaways:

1. They think conservatives are actually just libertarians, and that libertarians are stupid

2. They don't like Jesus very much

They are literally calling 90% of conservatives fake and leftist enablers, or at least 90% of them until about a year ago. And even now, a lot of conservatives haven't denounced Jesus. This site also supports monarchy, and not just monarchy, but absolute monarchy, which is *totally* pro-american and everything. Everything on that site is absolutely ridiculous and looks like CNN wrote it or something. Their definition of conservatism as using government to conserve the past and make sure everything stays the same forever is completely off the mark. Going by every other source except leftist news, it has always meant staying true to american ideals, thus protecting our freedom and rights against the progressives who have other priorities and want to expand the nanny state.

Support for limited government, individual rights, equality under the law, and free markets is waning. None of this was happening until about a year ago. Up until then, conservatives could be defined as rooted in the moderately libertarian founding values of the USA, with some republic thrown in as necessary. That's definitely not true anymore. body: If you like the Federalist party then yeah. But despite what the media says, conservatives until recently always followed the footsteps of the Anti-Federalist/Democratic-Republican party, the one that favored individual rights, limited federal government, free markets, and more state decisions than federal. The Democrats (big government) were and are like the Federalists. In fact the Democrats have always been the party of racism and intolerance, they just flipped to the other side recently for some reason (but still behave the same way).

I wouldn't say so, because this new philosophy doesn't at all align with founding values.

Lately I've seen a lot of comments saying certain people should be banned from being able to hold office, serve in the military, or even be censored (this thread alone has many examples). I've even seen a few complaining about how there's too much diversity and that's our problem (it used to be forced diversity that was complained about, because it's annoying PC crap). Even the sidebar of this guild says "no egalitarianism", which used to be one of the constitutional pillars for conservatives, "all men are created equal" (to clarify: in the sense of equality, not equity). Support for limited government, individual rights, equality under the law, and free markets is waning. None of this was happening until about a year ago. Up until then, conservatives could be defined as rooted in the moderately libertarian founding values of the USA, with some republic thrown in as necessary. That's definitely not true anymore. Many conservatives had strong beliefs but it was vital that they not be forced on others like the Democrats do, especially by the government. But now many of you want just that. If I had seen conservatives just 5 years ago I wouldn't even recognize you now. What the fuck happened? Are you trying to actually become what the media has been slandering you as for all these years?

Okay after looking at that I'm almost positive it's some kind of false flag site. Right off the bat, I get 2 main takeaways:

1. They think conservatives are actually just libertarians, and that libertarians are stupid

2. They don't like Jesus very much

They are literally calling 90% of conservatives fake and leftist enablers, or at least 90% of them until about a year ago. And even now, a lot of conservatives haven't denounced Jesus. This site also supports monarchy, and not just monarchy, but absolute monarchy, which is *totally* pro-american and everything. Everything on that site is absolutely ridiculous and looks like CNN wrote it or something. Their definition of conservatism as using government to conserve the past and make sure everything stays the same forever is completely off the mark. Going by every other source except leftist news, it has always meant staying true to american ideals, thus protecting our freedom and rights against the progressives who have other priorities and want to expand the nanny state.

post.body:
I don't know what's going on in the past year or so, perhaps a reaction to the riots this summer and all the shit going on in recent months. But look at Joe Biden 40 years ago and all the "old Democrats" who were leftists with right-wing cultural beliefs and most of you sound exactly like them now.

What's happened is you abandoned freedom. What happened to small government, individual liberty, free markets, free speech, and the constitution? It seems you've become obsessed and fixated with nothing but beating the other side lately, and have been resorting to authoritarian means to do so. Are you even conservatives anymore? I wouldn't say so, because this new philosophy doesn't at all align with founding values.

Lately I've seen a lot of comments saying certain people should be banned from being able to hold office, serve in the military, or even be censored ([this thread ](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative/post/6ube/joe-biden-taps-transgender-official-as) alone has many examples). I've even seen a few complaining about how there's too much diversity and that's our problem (it used to be *forced* diversity that was complained about, because it's annoying PC crap). Even the sidebar of this guild says "no egalitarianism", which used to be one of the constitutional pillars for conservatives, "all men are created equal" (to clarify: in the sense of equality, not equity). Support for limited government, individual rights, equality under the law, and free markets is waning. None of this was happening until about a year ago. Up until then, conservatives could be defined as rooted in the moderately libertarian founding values of the USA, with some republic thrown in as necessary. That's definitely not true anymore. Many conservatives had strong beliefs but it was vital that they not be forced on others like the Democrats do, especially by the government. But now many of you want just that. If I had seen conservatives just 5 years ago I wouldn't even recognize you now. What the fuck happened? Are you trying to actually become what the media has been slandering you as for all these years?

Edit: See, this is another example of their censorship, the [+"Conservative"](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative) guild kicked this post because it doesn't support their new alt ideology, even though it's in line with actual conservatism.

post.body:
I don't know what's going on in the past year or so, perhaps a reaction to the riots this summer and all the shit going on in recent months. But look at Joe Biden 40 years ago and all the "old Democrats" who were leftists with right-wing cultural beliefs and most of you sound exactly like them now.

What's happened is you abandoned freedom. What happened to small government, individual liberty, free markets, free speech, and the constitution? It seems you've become obsessed and fixated with nothing but beating the other side lately, and have been resorting to authoritarian means to do so. Are you even conservatives anymore? I wouldn't say so, because this new philosophy doesn't at all align with founding values.

Lately I've seen a lot of comments saying certain people should be banned from being able to hold office, serve in the military, or even be censored ([this thread ](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative/post/6ube/joe-biden-taps-transgender-official-as) alone has many examples). I've even seen a few complaining about how there's too much diversity and that's our problem (it used to be *forced* diversity that was complained about, because it's annoying PC crap). Even the sidebar of this guild says "no egalitarianism", which used to be one of the constitutional pillars for conservatives, "all men are created equal" (to clarify: in the sense of equality, not equity). Support for limited government, individual rights, equality under the law, and free markets is waning. None of this was happening until about a year ago. Up until then, conservatives could be defined as rooted in the moderately libertarian founding values of the USA, with some republic thrown in as necessary. That's definitely not true anymore. Many conservatives had strong beliefs but it was vital that they not be forced on others like the Democrats do, especially by the government. But now many of you want just that. If I had seen conservatives just 5 years ago I wouldn't even recognize you now. What the fuck happened? Are you trying to actually become what the media has been slandering you as for all these years?

Edit: See, this is another example of their censorship, the [+"Conservative"](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative) guild kicked this post because it doesn't support their new alt ideology, even though it's in line with actual conservatism.

body:
I know you are talking about individuals changing their views over time, but I think one of the reasons you're seeing people abandoning neoconservatism for "alt right" or "populist" or whatever you want to call them beliefs is because the population of the United States is quite literally changing. 

1/6 people living in America weren't even born in America. Of course there has been a drop in traditional American values.

body:
Populist is much different than alt right. Populism is an anti-establishment position based on overthrowing an existing power and wanting to do a better job yourself. Donald Trump is a prime example of this. Alt right/fascism on the other hand is basically socialism with traditional cultural beliefs instead of progressive ones: it values conformity, hierarchy, nationality, and tradition above all else, and believes government's prime function should be enforcing them. It's solidly pro-establishment and it's basically what AHS and CNN thinks conservatism is. Both are inconsistent with the original conservatives but the former at least has an appeal after 8 years of Obama, yet many people have now become the latter.

I do get what you're saying about more people coming in from other countries, but as you said it's mostly the same individuals who were conservatives before becoming more alt right.

Republican politicians enthusiastically supported things like mass migration and the export of American manufacturing capability. It’s not surprising that their former voters no longer believe in the phony “small government” rhetoric that the Republican Party never actually practiced consistently anyway.

parent.body:
Conservatives are becoming alt right because they have no other option and are witnessing their civilization and way of life being destroyed

Republican politicians enthusiastically supported things like mass migration and the export of American manufacturing capability. It’s not surprising that their former voters no longer believe in the phony “small government” rhetoric that the Republican Party never actually practiced consistently anyway.

post.body:
I don't know what's going on in the past year or so, perhaps a reaction to the riots this summer and all the shit going on in recent months. But look at Joe Biden 40 years ago and all the "old Democrats" who were leftists with right-wing cultural beliefs and most of you sound exactly like them now.

What's happened is you abandoned freedom. What happened to small government, individual liberty, free markets, free speech, and the constitution? It seems you've become obsessed and fixated with nothing but beating the other side lately, and have been resorting to authoritarian means to do so. Are you even conservatives anymore? I wouldn't say so, because this new philosophy doesn't at all align with founding values.

Lately I've seen a lot of comments saying certain people should be banned from being able to hold office, serve in the military, or even be censored ([this thread ](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative/post/6ube/joe-biden-taps-transgender-official-as) alone has many examples). I've even seen a few complaining about how there's too much diversity and that's our problem (it used to be *forced* diversity that was complained about, because it's annoying PC crap). Even the sidebar of this guild says "no egalitarianism", which used to be one of the constitutional pillars for conservatives, "all men are created equal" (to clarify: in the sense of equality, not equity). Support for limited government, individual rights, equality under the law, and free markets is waning. None of this was happening until about a year ago. Up until then, conservatives could be defined as rooted in the moderately libertarian founding values of the USA, with some republic thrown in as necessary. That's definitely not true anymore. Many conservatives had strong beliefs but it was vital that they not be forced on others like the Democrats do, especially by the government. But now many of you want just that. If I had seen conservatives just 5 years ago I wouldn't even recognize you now. What the fuck happened? Are you trying to actually become what the media has been slandering you as for all these years?

Edit: See, this is another example of their censorship, the [+"Conservative"](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative) guild kicked this post because it doesn't support their new alt ideology, even though it's in line with actual conservatism.

Much of the old testament is apocryphal

Support for limited government, individual rights, equality under the law, and free markets is waning. None of this was happening until about a year ago. Up until then, conservatives could be defined as rooted in the moderately libertarian founding values of the USA, with some republic thrown in as necessary. That's definitely not true anymore. Many conservatives had strong beliefs but it was vital that they not be forced on others like the Democrats do, especially by the government. But now many of you want just that. If I had seen conservatives just 5 years ago I wouldn't even recognize you now. What the fuck happened? Are you trying to actually become what the media has been slandering you as for all these years?

Edit: See, this is another example of their censorship, the [+"Conservative"](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative) guild kicked this post because it doesn't support their new alt ideology, even though it's in line with actual conservatism.

body: This was before that. There was no earthly king from the time they entered the promise land until they demanded one, which is when they were permitted to appoint Saul (and also warned that it was a poor decision). Babylonian captivity didn't happen until the time of Daniel and Ezra, long after many kings had already reigned.

parent.body:
Much of the old testament is apocryphal

The Jewish priest caste had recently been freed from captivity in Babylon by Cyrus the Great and had a very tangible interest in convincing the Jewish people that having a Jewish King wasn't important, and that instead they should accept Persian suzerainty administered locally via the Jewish priest caste

body:
Yes stories of Saul and David predate the Babylonian captivity but they were not written down in their current form until after the Babylonian captivity.

There probably was an Etruscan King of Rome named Tarquin who was overthrown by republicans but anything from that era of Roman history is taken with a grain of salt by modern historians because we don't have much in the way of contemporary primary sources from that place and time. The same is true of King David and Saul.

Much of the old testament is collections of folktales and mythical heroes. You'll note there are multiple different stories in the Bible about how David and Saul met, about how the Jews captured Jerusalem, and even about who killed Goliath.

You'll also note that the stories of David and Saul are actually older than the story of Exodus despite supposedly occurring chronologically after Exodus supposedly happens. One of the reasons we know this is because their are references to David keeping idols (which no post Moses Jew would do). The Exodus tale seems to be manufactured from whole cloth then inserted into the historical narrative to, once again, justify the spiritual authority of a priest caste returning from foreign captivity. This is also the time in history where Judaism picks up a lot of Zoroastrian influence. 

On the subject of Saul and his unworthiness to be king, Saul's first fall out with God comes because Saul does not commit ethnic cleansing thoroughly enough.

"Now go and smite Amalek, and utterly destroy all that they have, and spare them not; but slay both man and woman, infant and suckling, ox and sheep, camel and ass." Samuel-1 15:3

You gotta love how Yahweh specifically reminds the Israelites to not forget to kill the babies too.

body:
David had idols because he was being idolatrous, not because he was supposed to. He also had multiple wives and owned prostitute slaves. And his son Solomon was even worse. Both of them were not commended for it. Just so you know, a fragment of Numbers was discovered on an amulet found in Jerusalem, in the alphabet they used prior to Babylonian captivity.

Also what you have to understand about the wars and stuff is that they had to do it or they wouldn't have survived because it would've been done to them. The world they lived in was brutal as fuck, and that was nothing compared to what all the other nations were doing.

![](https://i.ruqqus.com/comment/o9dp/oFjHK8qM-p4)

body:
"He also had multiple wives and owned prostitute slaves"

That is legal according to Jewish religious law

"Just so you know, a fragment of Numbers was discovered on an amulet found in Jerusalem, in the alphabet they used prior to Babylonian captivity"

That does not in any way contradict my assertion, which is shared by most ancient middle eastern scholars, that the old testament in its current form was compiled and edited from preexisting myths and legends to form a narrative that was politically expedient for the people writing it at the time. 

"Dr. Wayne Pitard has stated that although evidence for the antiquity of the Priestly Blessing is now compelling, this does not necessarily mean that the Book of Numbers already existed at that time.[8] Dr. James R. Davila has similarly pointed out that the idea that while the scrolls show that "some of the material found in the Five Books of Moses existed in the First Temple period", the suggestion that they are "proof that the Five Books of Moses were in existence during the First Temple period" (as described in an article in the Israeli newspaper Haaretz) is "an overinterpretation of the evidence.""

https://paleojudaica.blogspot.com/2004_09_26_archive.html#109644758320238769

https://www.nytimes.com/2004/09/28/science/solving-a-riddle-written-in-silver.html

David had idols because he was being idolatrous, not because he was supposed to. He also had multiple wives and owned prostitute slaves. And his son Solomon was even worse. Both of them were not commended for it. Just so you know, a fragment of Numbers was discovered on an amulet found in Jerusalem, in the alphabet they used prior to Babylonian captivity.

Also what you have to understand about the wars and stuff is that they had to do it or they wouldn't have survived because it would've been done to them. The world they lived in was brutal as fuck, and that was nothing compared to what all the other nations were doing.

![](https://i.ruqqus.com/comment/o9dp/oFjHK8qM-p4)

post.body:
I don't know what's going on in the past year or so, perhaps a reaction to the riots this summer and all the shit going on in recent months. But look at Joe Biden 40 years ago and all the "old Democrats" who were leftists with right-wing cultural beliefs and most of you sound exactly like them now.

What's happened is you abandoned freedom. What happened to small government, individual liberty, free markets, free speech, and the constitution? It seems you've become obsessed and fixated with nothing but beating the other side lately, and have been resorting to authoritarian means to do so. Are you even conservatives anymore? I wouldn't say so, because this new philosophy doesn't at all align with founding values.

Lately I've seen a lot of comments saying certain people should be banned from being able to hold office, serve in the military, or even be censored ([this thread ](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative/post/6ube/joe-biden-taps-transgender-official-as) alone has many examples). I've even seen a few complaining about how there's too much diversity and that's our problem (it used to be *forced* diversity that was complained about, because it's annoying PC crap). Even the sidebar of this guild says "no egalitarianism", which used to be one of the constitutional pillars for conservatives, "all men are created equal" (to clarify: in the sense of equality, not equity). Support for limited government, individual rights, equality under the law, and free markets is waning. None of this was happening until about a year ago. Up until then, conservatives could be defined as rooted in the moderately libertarian founding values of the USA, with some republic thrown in as necessary. That's definitely not true anymore. Many conservatives had strong beliefs but it was vital that they not be forced on others like the Democrats do, especially by the government. But now many of you want just that. If I had seen conservatives just 5 years ago I wouldn't even recognize you now. What the fuck happened? Are you trying to actually become what the media has been slandering you as for all these years?

Edit: See, this is another example of their censorship, the [+"Conservative"](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative) guild kicked this post because it doesn't support their new alt ideology, even though it's in line with actual conservatism.

body:
> That is legal according to Jewish religious law

Prostitution is not legal, and polygamy was forbidden for kings.

> That does not in any way contradict my assertion, which is shared by most ancient middle eastern scholars, that the old testament in its current form was compiled and edited from preexisting myths and legends to form a narrative that was politically expedient for the people writing it at the time.

Yes it does, as you said the pentacheuch wasn't written until after the Babylonian captivity, and that right there is a fragment of the book of Numbers in Jerusalem from the first temple period. It's an amulet, so of course it's only going to include part of it. Also, there is an inscription in Egypt which may refer to Moses. A list of 10 virtues was also found in egypt that is very much like the ten commandments, which at the very least shows that the two groups influenced each other. And the alphabet used by the Canaanites and Israelites is clearly based on egyptian hieroglyphics. There is quite a lot of evidence that the Hebrews came to Canaan from Egypt.
body_html:
That is legal according to Jewish religious law

Prostitution is not legal, and polygamy was forbidden for kings.

That does not in any way contradict my assertion, which is shared by most ancient middle eastern scholars, that the old testament in its current form was compiled and edited from preexisting myths and legends to form a narrative that was politically expedient for the people writing it at the time.

Yes it does, as you said the pentacheuch wasn't written until after the Babylonian captivity, and that right there is a fragment of the book of Numbers in Jerusalem from the first temple period. It's an amulet, so of course it's only going to include part of it. Also, there is an inscription in Egypt which may refer to Moses. A list of 10 virtues was also found in egypt that is very much like the ten commandments, which at the very least shows that the two groups influenced each other. And the alphabet used by the Canaanites and Israelites is clearly based on egyptian hieroglyphics. There is quite a lot of evidence that the Hebrews came to Canaan from Egypt.

guild.description:
A guild all about the United States of America, also known as United States or the USA. Post news, memes and discussion about the US of A here!

There are only 4 rules here:
- No NSFW posts.
- **No posts made by bots.**
- Posts must relate to part, or all, of the United States of America in some way.
- Follow the Ruqqus TOS.

parent.body:
"He also had multiple wives and owned prostitute slaves"

That is legal according to Jewish religious law

"Just so you know, a fragment of Numbers was discovered on an amulet found in Jerusalem, in the alphabet they used prior to Babylonian captivity"

That does not in any way contradict my assertion, which is shared by most ancient middle eastern scholars, that the old testament in its current form was compiled and edited from preexisting myths and legends to form a narrative that was politically expedient for the people writing it at the time. 

"Dr. Wayne Pitard has stated that although evidence for the antiquity of the Priestly Blessing is now compelling, this does not necessarily mean that the Book of Numbers already existed at that time.[8] Dr. James R. Davila has similarly pointed out that the idea that while the scrolls show that "some of the material found in the Five Books of Moses existed in the First Temple period", the suggestion that they are "proof that the Five Books of Moses were in existence during the First Temple period" (as described in an article in the Israeli newspaper Haaretz) is "an overinterpretation of the evidence.""

https://paleojudaica.blogspot.com/2004_09_26_archive.html#109644758320238769

https://www.nytimes.com/2004/09/28/science/solving-a-riddle-written-in-silver.html

post.body:
I don't know what's going on in the past year or so, perhaps a reaction to the riots this summer and all the shit going on in recent months. But look at Joe Biden 40 years ago and all the "old Democrats" who were leftists with right-wing cultural beliefs and most of you sound exactly like them now.

What's happened is you abandoned freedom. What happened to small government, individual liberty, free markets, free speech, and the constitution? It seems you've become obsessed and fixated with nothing but beating the other side lately, and have been resorting to authoritarian means to do so. Are you even conservatives anymore? I wouldn't say so, because this new philosophy doesn't at all align with founding values.

Lately I've seen a lot of comments saying certain people should be banned from being able to hold office, serve in the military, or even be censored ([this thread ](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative/post/6ube/joe-biden-taps-transgender-official-as) alone has many examples). I've even seen a few complaining about how there's too much diversity and that's our problem (it used to be *forced* diversity that was complained about, because it's annoying PC crap). Even the sidebar of this guild says "no egalitarianism", which used to be one of the constitutional pillars for conservatives, "all men are created equal" (to clarify: in the sense of equality, not equity). Support for limited government, individual rights, equality under the law, and free markets is waning. None of this was happening until about a year ago. Up until then, conservatives could be defined as rooted in the moderately libertarian founding values of the USA, with some republic thrown in as necessary. That's definitely not true anymore. Many conservatives had strong beliefs but it was vital that they not be forced on others like the Democrats do, especially by the government. But now many of you want just that. If I had seen conservatives just 5 years ago I wouldn't even recognize you now. What the fuck happened? Are you trying to actually become what the media has been slandering you as for all these years?

Edit: See, this is another example of their censorship, the [+"Conservative"](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative) guild kicked this post because it doesn't support their new alt ideology, even though it's in line with actual conservatism.
